full_summary:
### Western Canada Asset Condition Assessment 2023
#### Service Provision Opportunity

Parks Canada invites bids from qualified proponents to provide architectural and engineering services for the condition assessment of assets in Western Canada. The services aim to improve understanding of maintenance requirements for the long-term sustainability of Parks Canada’s assets and to produce funding estimates to support resource allocation planning.

**Provision Opportunity Details:**

* Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0054/A
* Closing Date: 2023-06-29T16:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-07-13
* Expected Contract End Date: 2024-03-04

**Contract Scope:**

The contract will involve the assessment of assets in four geographical zones: Alberta, British Columbia, the Prairies (Saskatchewan and Manitoba), and the North (Yukon and Northwest Territories). A maximum of four contracts will be awarded, one for each zone. Proponents may bid on one or more zones.

**Submission Guidelines:**

Bids must be submitted via fax or email to the specified contracting authority. Please refer to the solicitation documents for details on bounceback or description stencil files. Emails must be sent to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Only attachments to emails will be accepted.

**Security Requirements:**

Staff security clearances will require fingerprinting for background checks. Bidders are responsible for any associated costs.

**Inquiries:**

Technical and contractual inquiries should be submitted in writing to the contracting authority no later than five (6) working days prior to the closing date.

**Important Information:**

The National Parks Regulations require all work to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

**Additional Information:**

Complete solicitation documents, including addenda, are available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service website at http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. By submitting a bid, proponents acknowledge they have reviewed and complied with all conditions and terms included in the solicitation documents.

Please ensure all communications with the contracting authority are conducted in accordance with the solicitation requirements. Late bids will not be considered, and the Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

[BIDDER *contact Information] MUST ATTACH ALL REQUIRED DOCS AND PROVIDE COMPLETE CONTACT INFORMATION. EACH APPROACH WILL BE TREATED INDEPENDENTLY BY THE CONTRACTING AUTHORITY.]
